title: Lab Learning Sessions
text:
Welcome
Welcome to our Lab Learning Sessions website!
This is a series of interactive tutorials, designed to help us: - Review core statistical and machine learning methods, - Practice reproducible analysis in R/Julia/Python, - Build shared conceptual and technical skills as a team.
Each session is built as a Quarto notebook, mixing:

üìñ Concepts & equations
üíª Live code examples
üìä Visualizations
üó£Ô∏è Discussion prompts




How to Use

Navigate through the Sessions tab in the menu.
Code is folded by default ‚Äì click Code to expand and run interactively.
All datasets are toy examples, designed to run quickly.







Tip



Clone the repository and run quarto preview locally if you want to experiment with the code.





Sessions Overview
Here‚Äôs the roadmap for our first set of sessions:

Session 1: PCA, PCR, and PLS Dimensionality reduction, supervised vs unsupervised components.

(More topics to come, shaped by lab interest!)



Contributing

Want to lead a session? Fork the repo and add a new .qmd in sessions/.
Got an idea for a topic? Add it to our shared list or bring it up at lab meeting.




Credits
This series is maintained by The Klepac-Ceraj Lab @ Wellesley College. Structure and curation by Guilherme Fahur Bottino, Ph.D. It‚Äôs powered by Quarto, and all content is open for adaptation and improvement.

title: Learning Session 1: PCA, PCR, and PLS
text:
This is the first session of our Lab Learning Sessions series.
We‚Äôll explore three related but different approaches:

PCA (Principal Component Analysis)
PCR (Principal Component Regression)
PLS (Partial Least Squares)

All methods use the same data matrix, but optimize different goals.



Understand the objectives and math of PCA, PCR, and PLS.

Run each method on a toy dataset.

Visualize and compare results.

title: Learning Session 1: PCA, PCR, and PLS
text:
5.1 Equations

Covariance matrix:
\[
S = \frac{1}{n-1} X^\top X
\]
Eigen decomposition:
\[
S v_k = \lambda_k v_k
\]
Principal component scores:
\[
t_k = X v_k
\]

title: Learning Session 1: PCA, PCR, and PLS
text:
5.2 R Code


Code
pca_res <- prcomp(X, scale. = TRUE)
summary(pca_res)


Importance of components:
                          PC1    PC2     PC3     PC4
Standard deviation     1.7802 0.8300 0.34094 0.16080
Proportion of Variance 0.7923 0.1722 0.02906 0.00646
Cumulative Proportion  0.7923 0.9645 0.99354 1.00000




Code
pca_loadings <- data.frame(pca_res$rotation[,1:2], var = rownames(pca_res$rotation))
library(ggplot2)
p1 <- ggplot(pca_loadings, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, label = var)) +
  geom_point() + geom_text(vjust = -0.5) +
  ggtitle("PCA Loadings (X only)")
p1

title: Learning Session 1: PCA, PCR, and PLS
text:
7.1 Equation

Find weights \(w_1\) that maximize: \[
\max_{w} \; \text{Cov}(Xw, y)^2 \quad \text{s.t. } \|w\|=1
\]
Latent variable: \[
t_1 = X w_1
\]
